main event: Major William J. Hayner, the Air Provost Marshal at Holloman Air Force Base, along with five other witnesses, observed an unusual aerial phenomenon on March 5, 1950 at Vaughan, New Mexico.
interesting points: The object was round in shape, like a ping pong ball, and appeared to be a very brilliant white light.
The object traveled at an estimated speed of 180-200 miles per hour, crossing the lens of a Mitchell camera from 10 o'clock to 3 o'clock in 2 minutes and 55 seconds.
The object was observed for approximately 1 hour and 25 minutes before diminishing in size and disappearing from view.
No logical explanation for the object could be provided by the Ballistics & Ammunition Branch or Weather Department at Holloman Air Force Base.
A negative of a movie film taken of the object is maintained at the Holloman Air Force Base photo lab.
witnesses: Major William J. Hayner, Air Provost Marshal, Holloman AFB, and five other observers
photographs: yes, a movie film was taken of the object
